channel.title: Getting My Server Up and Running
channel.description: Okay, so I've downloaded my DUC program and it shows my server when I open it though how do I let people play the server?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 30, 2007, 03:29:34 PM[/size][hr]Please reply, I've compiled, I click Runserver.bat though how do I make it so that people can play?

item.title: Getting My Server Up and Running
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

icauseownage:

if you have an anti virus, disable it just go to start>run> type msconfig and go to services and start up and uncheck the boxes that involve ur anti virus/and firewall. though when you are in services there is a box at the bottom that says ‘hide all microsoft services’ check that box! and then look through the list for ur antivrus/firewall. because the anti virus blocks port 2224 to share a TCP connection between YOU and the person connecting to your server.

Dont Confuse Him Lol, Put That Into Super With Extra Easiness , Newb Language

Read full topic
item.source: Getting My Server Up and Running

item.title: Getting My Server Up and Running
item.dc:creator: @icauseownage icauseownage
item.description:
@icauseownage wrote:

if you have an anti virus, disable it just go to start>run> type msconfig and go to services and start up and uncheck the boxes that involve ur anti virus/and firewall. though when you are in services there is a box at the bottom that says ‘hide all microsoft services’ check that box! and then look through the list for ur antivrus/firewall. because the anti virus blocks port 2224 to share a TCP connection between YOU and the person connecting to your server.
